climbs.name: Pepsi Challenge
climbs.fa: Jim Bodenhamer, JD Mckay, Mike Sanders et al

content.description:
You start with high feet over the roof and it's best if you are tall.  

  Up higher, getting to the first bolt felt a little committing . The holds were fine. Just steep enough to keep your head on straight.
content.protection: standard rack to #4 Camalot, nuts, one bolt (with the old one still next to it)
content.location: East of the big dihedral is a low roof (@ 3-4' above the ground);

content.description: The two bulges are the crux. One big one low and a smaller one up high. Follow thin crack to the final face above. It needs a bit more pruning up high but you can easily avoid the thorny bush.
content.location: Right of Pepsi Challenge @ 15' is the left facing dihedral with the the two roofs.

content.description: Next wall east of Crag Central; look for a left facing corner, it is between the first and second routes here. The rock is great.
